content:
/>
VIII.ii.1.B.1.b
.
When to Apply Undiagnosed Illness and MUCMI Procedures
The procedures of this topic apply to any Gulf War era Veteran who
presents with a sign or symptom of an undiagnosed illness or MUCMI as noted in
38 CFR 3.317(b)
, and
served in a location currently recognized as Southwest Asia Theater of Operations under
38 CFR 3.317(e)(2)
or a Persian Gulf Veteran location in
38 U.S.C. 1117
.
Important
:  While several locations in
38 CFR 3.317
and
38 U.S.C. 1117
overlap with
38 U.S.C. 1119
locations, not all locations qualify under both statutes.
References
:  For more information on
claims that fall under more than one qualifying service location, see the
Gulf War Era Service Areas Job Aid
, and
considering multiple theories of service connection, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.e
, and
the
PACT Act Implementation SOP
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B - Developing Presumptive Service Connection (SC) Claims from Persian Gulf Veterans
citation: Part VIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B
